thread.title: Sports Roundup: UCA and Hendrix volleyball; UCA soccer
thread.title_full: Sports Roundup: UCA and Hendrix volleyball; UCA soccer

author: Staff
title: Sports Roundup: UCA and Hendrix volleyball; UCA soccer
text:
Sports Roundup: UCA and Hendrix volleyball; UCA soccer Posted: October 17, 2015 - 10:36pm LOG CABIN DEMOMCRAT 
HUNTSVILLE, Texas – The University of Central Arkansas Sugar Bears closed out a four-match road trip at Sam Houston State on Saturday afternoon, taking down the Bearkats in straight sets, 25-20, 25-12, 25-21. On the day, Central Arkansas hit .256, but limited the Bearkats to an attack percentage of just -.060 thanks to 47 digs and 14 blocks. Heather Schnars led the defensive effort with a match-high 15 digs, while freshman Allie Kemp tallied 11, and Amy South chipped in nine. At the net, Megan Nash picked up a match-high seven blocks, followed closely by freshmen Nicole Peters and Samantha Anderson, who blocked six and five Sam Houston attacks. HENDRIX VOLLEYBALL 
Friday night, Berry handed the Warriors their first conference defeat, 25-22, 25-23, 25-13 at Grove Gymnasium. The 24th-ranked Warriors’ 10-match winning streak was snapped. UCA WOMEN’S SOCCER 
Sabriah Spencer’s golden goal from 25 yards out in overtime Friday night gave Houston Baptist (7-4-1, 5-1) a 2-1 victory over the University of Central Arkansas’ women’s soccer team at the Stephens Complex. Ashley Smith’s header in the 59th minute was the only goal for the Bears (6-8-1, 3-3-1). Central Arkansas plays its final home match on Sunday, hosting Texas A&M-Corpus Christi at 1 p.m.
